metadata.titel_preek: Twelfth Sunday After Pentecost: Hebrews 12 / Trinity Sunday / Psalm 130

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, whose inner nature is self-giving love, pursues and redeems a humanity that is fundamentally 'off the rails' and incapable of saving itself.

tekstueel_bewijs: God pursues us even beyond the grave
God’s love spends itself to the very last drop
He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities

object.identificatie: The redemption and restoration of the 'miserable offender' (Humanity)

zender.identificatie: The Triune Nature of God (Inner core of being)
tekstueel_bewijs: The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness that pours itself out
give that love to his creatures without restraint
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the one in the 'depths').

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ and the Holy Spirit (as well as human 'hints' of love)
tekstueel_bewijs: love that has become incarnate in history through Jesus Christ
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject acting through the Persons of the Trinity.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin as a 'Vast Primordial Catastrophe' and Human Resistance
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described not as petty mistakes but as a catastrophe that renders humanity totally unable to 'stand' before God.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Human beings reflecting God's love to one another as a 'glimmer' of the divine radiance.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Human (Parent, Aunt, Youth Leader)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Human love is presented as a 'hint' or 'measure' that points toward the primary program of God's love.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God pursues us even beyond the grave.
The love of God bears all things.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: The psalmist ceases to reflect upon himself.
Imagine for a moment that you are the parent.

voorbeelden: things which we ought to have done
God... whose nature it is to give that love
discovery that he is a God of infinite mercy
God who pursues us... with his resurrection power
total inability to present ourselves righteous

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes human 'non-pouvoir' (inability) met by God's 'pouvoir' (resurrection power/mercy).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (The Depths) through the negation of ~S1 (rejecting record keeping) to S1 (Forgiveness/Fear of the Lord).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'Fear of the Lord' which is a response to the majesty of forgiveness.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 is described as a 'vast primordial catastrophe'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject of salvation while defining the human condition as one of total inability.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in the parent analogy
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Imagine for a moment that you are the parent...

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God pursues us even beyond the grave with his resurrection power.
There is no human being who can come up with enough credits.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Human parents/caregivers are used as analogies, but the preacher explicitly subordinates them as mere 'hints' of the real Subject (God).
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this by moving from Paul's desperation to the Trinitarian blessing.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and 'renewed confidence' arising from external rescue.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic undertones; salvation is entirely God's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'depths' of the Psalm to the 'radiance' of the Trinity is logically and narratively tight.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'fear of the Lord' and 'joyous knowledge'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The love that persists in breaking through our resistance.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'fellowship' and 'pouring forth' of God's own competence into the believer.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is an 'impulse toward self-destruction' that no human can overcome.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is God-driven. The human actant is correctly positioned as the 'Receiver' of an action they cannot perform.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic grace structure.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The sermon could slightly more explicitly link the 'watchman' imagery to the 'Savoir' (knowing/waiting) of the believer.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The opponent is already sufficiently 'heavy' to necessitate a Divine Subject.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Program 1) clearly grounds the possibility of any secondary program.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject. It avoids the trap of turning the Trinity into a social model for us to imitate, instead presenting it as the source of a love that rescues us.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'parent' pathos, Greimas shows that the parent is merely a 'Helper/Signifier' for the ultimate 'Subject' (God).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek/Hebrew; semiotics explains that the 'engine' of the text is the movement from human 'non-pouvoir' to divine 'pouvoir'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Fear of the Lord' functions as a modal transformation where the Receiver is given a new 'Savoir' (wisdom) based on the Subject's 'Performance' (forgiveness).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses Rutledge's grammar effectively, ensuring that even when humans act (confessing), it is a response to God's prior action.
